_comment: Brazil compliance norms and standards database. Includes ANATEL, INMETRO, NBR standards, ANVISA and other Brazilian regulatory requirements. Updated for 2025 compliance requirements.

norms.name: National Telecommunications Agency - Product Homologation
norms.applies_to: Telecommunications equipment and radio transmitting devices
norms.description: Mandatory homologation for telecom products and radio equipment. Testing at ANATEL-accredited labs. Certification required before import or sale. Covers WiFi, Bluetooth, cellular, all radio devices. ANATEL seal required on product.

norms.name: Specific Absorption Rate Requirements
norms.applies_to: Mobile phones and body-worn wireless devices
norms.description: SAR limit: 2.0 W/kg averaged over 10g of tissue. Testing required for handheld and body-worn devices. Part of ANATEL homologation. Must be declared in documentation.

norms.name: Electromagnetic Compatibility Requirements for Telecom Equipment
norms.description: EMC requirements for telecom equipment. Emission and immunity testing. Part of ANATEL homologation process. Based on international standards with Brazilian adaptations.

norms.name: National Institute of Metrology - Compulsory Certification
norms.applies_to: Products under compulsory certification (electronics, appliances, cables, plugs)
norms.description: Mandatory certification for products on INMETRO list. Testing at accredited labs. Factory inspection required. INMETRO mark required on product and packaging. Covers electrical products, toys, personal protective equipment.

norms.name: Voluntary Product Certification Program
norms.description: Voluntary certification demonstrating compliance with Brazilian standards. Market differentiation. Various certification marks available. Testing and factory audit required.

norms.name: Audio/Video, ICT Equipment - Safety
norms.description: Brazilian adoption of IEC 62368-1. Hazard-based safety standard for ICT equipment. Required for INMETRO certification of IT products. Replaces NBR IEC 60950-1.

norms.name: Household Appliances - Safety - General Requirements
norms.description: Brazilian adoption of IEC 60335-1. General safety requirements for household appliances. Required for INMETRO certification. Part of comprehensive NBR 60335 series.

norms.name: Plugs and Socket-Outlets for Household Use
norms.description: Brazilian standard plug and socket system (Type N). Mandatory for products sold in Brazil. Three-pin grounded configuration. Voltage compatibility (127V or 220V) marking required.

norms.name: Lithium Batteries - Safety Requirements
norms.description: Brazilian adoption of IEC 62133-2. Safety requirements for portable lithium batteries. Required for INMETRO certification of battery products and power banks.

norms.name: Multimedia Equipment - EMC Emission Requirements
norms.description: Brazilian adoption of CISPR 32. EMC emission requirements for multimedia equipment. Used for EMC compliance testing.

norms.name: Brazilian Labeling Program - Household Appliances
norms.description: Mandatory energy efficiency labeling (Etiqueta Nacional de Conservação de Energia - ENCE). A-E scale (A most efficient). Required for refrigerators, air conditioners, washing machines, TVs, monitors, etc. INMETRO administered.

norms.name: National Program for Electric Energy Conservation - Seal
norms.description: Voluntary energy efficiency seal. PROCEL seal awarded to most efficient products in category. Market recognition and preference. Complements mandatory PBE labeling.

norms.name: Minimum Energy Performance Standards
norms.description: Mandatory minimum energy efficiency levels. Products must meet MEPS to receive certification. Progressively stricter requirements. Part of PBE program.

norms.name: National Health Surveillance Agency - Medical Device Registration
norms.description: Mandatory registration for medical devices. Classification I-IV based on risk. Good Manufacturing Practice certification required. Clinical data may be required. ANVISA pre-market approval.

norms.name: Good Manufacturing Practices for Medical Devices
norms.description: Brazilian GMP requirements for medical devices. Based on ISO 13485 with Brazilian requirements. Certification required for device registration. Factory inspection by ANVISA or accredited bodies.

norms.name: Medical Device Registration Requirements
norms.description: Technical requirements for medical device registration. Documentation, labeling in Portuguese, technical reports. Authorized representative in Brazil required for foreign manufacturers.

norms.name: National Traffic Council - Vehicle Regulations
norms.description: Vehicle safety and technical regulations. Mandatory equipment, construction standards, type approval. CONTRAN establishes standards, DENATRAN and INMETRO enforce. Based on international standards.

norms.name: Vehicle Air Pollution Control Program
norms.description: Vehicle emission standards. Phases P-7 and P-8 current (equivalent to Euro 5/6). Type approval required. OBD requirements. IBAMA (environmental agency) oversight.

norms.name: Automotive Component Certification
norms.description: Certification for automotive safety components. Seat belts, airbags, child restraints, helmets. INMETRO compulsory certification. Testing to NBR standards.

norms.name: INMETRO Toy Safety Certification
norms.description: Mandatory INMETRO certification for toys. Comprehensive safety requirements: mechanical, chemical, flammability, electrical. Based on NBR NM standards and ISO 8124. Age grading required.

norms.name: Safety of Toys - Mercosur Standard
norms.description: Mercosur harmonized toy safety standard. Mechanical and physical properties. Used for INMETRO toy certification. Covers choking hazards, sharp edges, toxic materials.

norms.name: Food Contact Materials Regulations
norms.applies_to: Materials and articles in contact with food
norms.description: Safety requirements for food contact materials. Resolutions for plastics, metals, ceramics, paper. Migration limits. Positive lists. ANVISA pre-market notification for new substances.

norms.name: Migration from Plastic Food Contact Materials
norms.description: Specific migration limits for plastic food contact materials. Positive list of authorized substances. Testing requirements. Labeling for appropriate use.

norms.name: Lei Geral de Proteção de Dados (General Data Protection Law)
norms.description: Brazilian data protection law. Similar to GDPR. Consent requirements, data subject rights, security measures, breach notification. ANPD (National Data Protection Authority) enforcement. Applies to connected devices and services.

norms.name: Brazilian Civil Rights Framework for the Internet
norms.description: Internet governance and user rights. Net neutrality, privacy, data retention. Complements LGPD. Affects online services and connected devices.

norms.name: National Environment Council - Environmental Regulations
norms.description: Environmental regulations for various sectors. Waste management, air/water pollution, hazardous materials. Affects product design, packaging, end-of-life. Multiple resolutions for different product types.

norms.name: National Solid Waste Policy - E-Waste
norms.description: Reverse logistics and producer responsibility for e-waste. Sectoral agreements for electronics, batteries, packaging. Collection and recycling obligations. Registration and reporting requirements.

norms.name: CONAMA Resolution 401/2008 - Battery Disposal
norms.description: Limits on heavy metals in batteries. Mandatory collection and recycling. Labeling requirements. Applies to portable batteries, automotive batteries, industrial batteries.

norms.name: National Solid Waste Policy - Packaging
norms.description: Reverse logistics for packaging waste. Shared responsibility between producers, distributors, retailers. Sectoral agreements. Increasing collection and recycling targets.

norms.name: Forest Code - Sustainable Sourcing
norms.applies_to: Products using wood or forest materials
norms.description: Requirements for legal and sustainable forestry. Traceability of wood and forest products. Affects furniture, packaging, paper products. DOF (Forest Origin Document) required.

norms.name: Código de Defesa do Consumidor (CDC)
norms.description: Comprehensive consumer protection law. Product safety, liability, recalls, warranty, consumer rights. PROCON enforcement. Strong consumer rights. Affects labeling, advertising, product design.

norms.name: Consumer Information and Labeling
norms.description: Mandatory labeling in Portuguese. Product information, warnings, usage instructions, manufacturer/importer details. Specific requirements for different product types. INMETRO oversight.

norms.name: Recall Requirements and Procedures
norms.description: Mandatory recall procedures for unsafe products. Public notification requirements. SENACON (National Consumer Secretariat) registration. Communication to PROCON and consumers. Repair, replacement, or refund.

norms.name: Legal Warranty (Garantia Legal)
norms.description: Mandatory legal warranty: 90 days for durable goods, 30 days for non-durable. In addition to manufacturer's commercial warranty. Product must be fit for purpose. Consumer rights to repair, replacement, or refund.

norms.name: Legal Metrology - Weights and Measures
norms.description: Verification of weights, measures, measuring instruments. Mandatory for instruments used in trade. Pre-packaged product quantity verification. Model approval and periodic verification.

norms.name: Industrial Property Law - Trademarks and Patents
norms.description: Trademark and patent protection. INPI (National Institute of Industrial Property) registration. Affects product marking, branding, technology licensing. Enforcement against counterfeits.

norms.name: Protected Geographic Indications
norms.description: Protection for geographic indications and appellations of origin. Affects regional products, food, beverages, crafts. INPI registration and protection.

norms.name: Fire Safety Standards - Building and Products
norms.description: Fire safety requirements from building codes. State-specific fire codes (São Paulo Decree, Rio regulations). Affects building materials, electrical equipment, fire detection and suppression. Fire brigade approval.

norms.name: National Cybersecurity Strategy
norms.description: Emerging cybersecurity requirements. Critical infrastructure protection. IoT security guidance. Incident reporting to CTIR (Computer Incident Response Team). Evolving regulatory landscape.

norms.name: General Telecommunications Law - LGT
norms.description: Framework for telecommunications regulation. ANATEL authority. Service authorization, technical requirements, consumer protection. Affects network equipment, terminal equipment.

norms.name: Mercosur Common Nomenclature (NCM)
norms.description: Product classification system based on HS codes. NCM code required for customs clearance. Determines import duties, IPI (excise tax), regulatory requirements. Accurate classification critical.

norms.name: SISCOMEX Import Licensing
norms.description: Automatic or non-automatic import licensing. Required for regulated products (electronics, telecom, medical, etc.). INMETRO, ANVISA, ANATEL approval needed before customs clearance. RADAR registration for importers.

norms.name: Chemical Substances Inventory and Registration
norms.description: Chemical substance registration under various agencies. ANVISA for health products, IBAMA for pesticides, MAPA for agriculture. Material Safety Data Sheets (FISPQ) required. GHS labeling.

norms.name: Personal Protective Equipment Certification
norms.description: Mandatory INMETRO certification for PPE. Certificate of Approval (CA) from Ministry of Labor required. Testing to NBR standards. Covers safety helmets, gloves, goggles, respirators, etc.

norms.name: Regulatory Norms for Occupational Safety (NRs)
norms.description: Occupational safety regulatory norms. Mandatory for employers. Affects machinery, electrical equipment, PPE, safety systems. Ministry of Labor enforcement. Various NRs for different hazards.

norms.name: Quality Management Systems (Brazilian Standard)
norms.description: Brazilian adoption of ISO 9001. Quality management system certification. INMETRO accredits certification bodies. Important for supplier qualification and government contracts.

norms.name: Environmental Management Systems (Brazilian Standard)
norms.description: Brazilian adoption of ISO 14001. Environmental management system certification. Increasingly required for suppliers to major corporations and for environmental licensing.

norms.name: Local Content and Supplier Development
norms.applies_to: Products for government procurement or incentive programs
norms.description: Local content requirements for certain sectors (oil/gas, automotive, IT). Supplier development programs. Tax incentives for domestic production. Affects product sourcing and manufacturing location decisions.
